text: This node will import the USD primitives specified by the LOP Path and Primitives parameters. The imported primitives are represented as

The primitives to be imported are specified by first selecting the paths of one or more USD Primitives and then specify how to traverse the USD hierarchy below those prims. You can choose to import only the prims listed in
(No Traversal), or import all the GPrims or components contained in the USD hierarchies below the prims list in

parameter pane is shown. The parameters on this pane allow you to search for prims using a bunch of different USD attributes and concepts. Note that doing custom traversals can be much slower than the other traversal types.
The USD primitives to import. This parameter accepts any USD
The name of the SOP primitive attribute that will be created to hold the scene graph path of the original USD primitive. Can be empty to skip the creation of this attribute.
The name of the SOP primitive attribute that will be created to hold the name of the original USD primitive. Can be empty to skip the creation of this attribute.
The frame to cook the LOP node. When importing animated geometry this could be set to $FF. For static geometry, it is much more efficient to set this to $RFSTART. Any time value will work though.

For each name listed in the Prim Path parameter, we can create a USD Packed Prim for just that prim or we can traverse the USD hierarchy contained in that prim and create USD Packed Prims the USD prims that match a criteria.
Create one USD Packed Prim for each entry in the Prim Path parameter.
Create one USD Packed Prim for each prim with kind
Create one USD Packed Prim for each gprim.
Create one USD Packed Prim for each prim of type
parameter pane that allows you to choose prims based on many criteria.
Enable this option to remove all layers created above Layer Break nodes on every input to the source LOP node. This will restrict the imported primitives to those created after any Layer Breaks.
How to display the pack prims created by this node.
The full geometry will be displayed in the viewport.
Only the points of the geometry will be displayed. This will take less memory and be faster to render.
Only display the bounding box of the geometry in the viewport.
Display a single point at the center of the bounding box.
Don’t display the geometry in the viewport.
Control the value of the SOP P point attribute that will be set on the packed primitive.
Use the center of the world position of the USD primitives bounding box.
Use the world position of the origin of the USD primitive.
Sections of a USD hierarchy can be marked to be used for a a specific purpose. Only sections mark as default purpose or one of the purposes listed here will be loaded.
USD prim types to select when doing a custom traversal of the USD hierarchy. The pulldown menu list all the valid types. Multiple types and wildcards are supported.
USD prim purposes to select when doing a custom traversal of the USD hierarchy. The pulldown menu lists all the valid purposes. Multiple purposes and wildcards are supported.
USD prim kinds to select when doing a custom traversal of the USD hierarchy. The pulldown menu lists all the valid kinds. Multiple kinds and wildcards are supported.
Pattern used match against prim names when doing a custom traversal of the USD hierarchy. Wildcards are supported.
Pattern used match against prim paths when doing a custom traversal of the USD hierarchy. Wildcards are supported.
If this is on, when a matching prim is found, that prim is returned and the traverse will continue looking for matches among the prims descendants. Is

is off,
        the traverse will not match any of the prims descendants.
Return only prims that are active.
Return only prims that are visible.
Return only prims that are imageable.
Return only prims that are defined.
Return only prims that are abstract.
Return only prims that are groups.
Return only prims that are models.
Return only prims that are instances.
Return only prims that are instance masters.
Return only prims that have clips.
